title: Folly Dolly Falls Walking Route

images.title: Richard Kay / Fault at Folly Dolly Falls, Meltham
images.caption: Fault at Folly Dolly Falls, Meltham. The line of the fault runs down the rock face to the left of the waterfall. The face of the waterfall is a massive sandstone exposure of the Upper Carboniferous Huddersfield White Rock with cross bedding. To the left of the fault soft shales can be seen dipping steeply.

images.title: Richard Kay / Folly Dolly Falls, Meltham
images.caption: The waterfall is marked on the 1:25,000 OS sheet. The story is that a woman called Dolly, who lived in one of the cottages above the waterfall, got into financial difficulties, but the ending of her sad story is not known.

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / Former tractor test track - Meltham
images.caption: Former tractor test track Meltham Greenway. This was a test track for the David Brown Tractor factory, which was approached by a straight driveway along the disused railway line.

images.title: Richard Kay / Meltham Greenway at Mean Lane bridge
images.caption: Meltham Greenway at Mean Lane bridge

images.title: Richard Kay / Ruined Folly Dolly Cottage
images.caption: Ruined Folly Dolly Cottage. There is not much left of this building, but the outlines of the walls can still be seen. The local people believe this to be the cottage where Folly Dolly (who gave her name to the nearby waterfall) lived.

images.title: Richard Kay / Site of Missing Footbridge, Meltham Greenway
images.caption: Site of Missing Footbridge, Meltham Greenway

description: This walk visits the pretty Folly Dolly Falls in Meltham in Yorkshire. You can reach the falls by picking up the Meltham Greenway on the eastern side of the town, parking at the Morrisons supermarket nearby. Follow the woodland trail east for just over half a mile and you will come to the waterfall on your left, through a gap in the fence. You can then follow some steps down to the falls. The falls are a bit of a local hidden gem and thought to take their name from a lady who lived in a nearby ruined cottage. The cascade is particularly impressive after heavy rainfall.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: In Meltham there's the Travellers Rest for some post walk refreshment. The pub has a friendly atmosphere and is a popular place for walkers. They have a lovely large garden area where you can enjoy great views with your meal. You can find them on Slaithwaite Rd with a postcode of HD9 5NH for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland trails on the greenway make for a pleasant dog walk. The Travellers Rest mentioned above is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To continue your walking in the area pick up the circular Meltham Walk and pay a visit to Deer Hill Reservoir and Butterley Reservoir. For more walking ideas in the area see the South Pennines Walks and Peak District Walks pages.

display_address: The Cobbles, Calmlands, Meltham, Kirklees, West Yorkshire, England, HD9 5QR, United Kingdom
